intro: Tarigidia aequiglumis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tarigidia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassy habitats. Tarigidia aequiglumis is often found in open, sunny environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
